thread.title: The AP Network’s Fall 2015 Accounts Payable & Procure-to-Pay Conference & Expo Features Two Keynote Speakers
thread.title_full: The AP Network’s Fall 2015 Accounts Payable & Procure-to-Pay Conference & Expo Features Two Keynote Speakers

author: Grace Brown
title: The AP Network’s Fall 2015 Accounts Payable & Procure-to-Pay Conference & Expo Features Two Keynote Speakers
text:
The AP Network (TAPN) is pleased to announce two keynote speakers for the fall 2015 Accounts Payable & Procure-to-Pay Conference & Expo on October 25-28, 2015, at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas. Hundreds of AP and P2P professionals are expected at the four-day event, which encompasses two days of general sessions and two days of workshops and certifications, interspersed with networking opportunities and professional recognition. The conference will open its first day of general sessions on Monday, October 26, at 8:30am with keynote Dan Lier. Lier’s high-energy presentation, entitled “Maximizing Your True Potential,” will kick off the conference with strategies to increase performance in both business and life. The presentation will focus on the psychology of a top performer, the power of a winning attitude, and Lier’s formula for success. Lier, based in Las Vegas, is a best-selling author, human behavior expert, and internationally recognized motivational speaker. He has presented over 3,500 talks at events around the globe and appeared regularly on HSN as America’s Coach, where he shared his strategies for success with millions.
The conference’s second keynote, on Wednesday, October 28, at 4:00pm, will be delivered by Doug Sleeter - Founder and President of The Sleeter Group, author, thought leader, publisher, columnist for CPA Practice Advisor, and seven-time recipient of Top 100 Most Influential People in Accounting. Sleeter’s presentation, entitled “The Future of Accounting,” will focus on leveraging the constant changes of technology and accounting software to help businesses become more successful and agile.
“The AP Network consciously made a decision for the fall 2015 AP & P2P Conference to feature two keynote speakers; one to speak specifically about technical AP strategy, and one to inspire, motivate, and humor the attendees,” said Brian Cuthbert, Executive Director of The AP Network. “The spring 2015 conference followed the same outline, and it was a huge success with attendees. They really appreciated the advice and expertise of an AP ‘celebrity’ of sorts, but they also enjoyed connecting on more of a personal level with someone who could coach them about self-betterment in any walk of life,” he added.
More information about the AP & P2P Conference & Expo’s keynotes, full program, and a comprehensive program guide can be found at http://www.iofm.com/conference-fall . Early Bird pricing for attendees is in effect until midnight on Friday, August 14, 2015.
About The AP Network
The AP Network is the largest global community for Accounts Payable, Procure-to-Pay and Financial Shared Services practitioners. TAPN advances the profession and supports its members’ success by sharing best practices, tools, and expertise and by fostering peer-to-peer engagement.
The AP Network is one of three membership network within the Institute of Finance and Management (IOFM). IOFM oversees five certification programs which have trained more than 15,000 financial operations professionals worldwide. IOFM’s three membership networks (The AP Network, The AR Network and The Controllers Network) feature industry research, benchmarking data, metrics, case studies, tools and other critical compliance resources. The Institute also produces on-demand e-learning resources and industry-leading conferences dedicated to AP, AR and Controllers. With growing certification and membership programs and a keen understanding of the issues and content critical to the profession, IOFM is the trusted source of information in the rapidly evolving field of financial operations.
